title: >>> HELL'S ANGELS
body_text:
A big-mouth, a giant killer, a silent assassin, and an "unSTOPAble" one.
Four combustible elements - one heated war.
It was no secret DODGEBALL 92 would throw a few curveballs, literally and figuratively. The team selections alone left players with puzzled looks on their faces, questioning the calls of the decision-makers. As for the stipulations, one second set in stone, the next changed completely, creating further havoc and chaos for the 20-plus in attendance. Though it took some time and effort to get the rules regulated and competitors situated, eventually DODGEBALL 92 would come to produce some five-star action on both a collective level and individual basis.
LAUREN WINSTON vs. ALISON BERTSCH
A never-before-seen match headlined the 92nd dodgeball spectacular. The sister of one of the birthday gals and a no fear, no nonsense powerhouse shared the spotlight in only the third
Pick Your Poison
match-up. With the addition of not one, but
two
rims, anything and everything was bound to happen during this explosive, three-hour encounter.
Team LAUREN won the kick-off round rather easily, lasting no more than ten minutes tops. But the award-winning Bertsch wouldn't back down, gaining the upper hand in Game 2. It was at the conclusion of these two action-packed games that the fast-paced, and almost suicidal "strategy" if you will ceased to exist.
Game 3 and especially Game 4, most notable for the remarkable showing of mega-star Tom Adams, would have the crowd on the edge of their seats. Easily comparable with that of DODGEBALL 90, this last hour and half will certainly be remembered for months to come. And yes, through the initial turmoil and some would say debatable stipulations, one word can truly sum up DODGEBALL 92;
memorable
.
The most unorganized, chaotic event in history? It may very well have been and that is truly something to remember.
Award-winning legend Lauren Winston picked up her third career win, defeating fearless frontrunner Alison Bertsch at DODGEBALL 92, 3 games to 1.
Moments & Stars
: Tom Adams's amazing 15-minute solo Game 4 performance; Sascha Basista and Dan Turner putting up one hell of a fight also in Game 4; the pregame shenanigans of John Tronolone and Juan Londono
"The event was one of the better ones that I have been too ... Game 4, while long as hell, was the most fun and the best I've palyed in a while. Good times."
- DAN TURNER
RECORDS
> Attendance: 27
> Notable Returns: Matt Larsen (Last appearance at DODGEBALL 71); Max O'Rielly (Last appearance at DODGEBALL 82); Meredith Lewis (Last appearance at DODGEBALL EIGHTY-THREE)
> New Players: (2) Chris Mullan and Evan Fenton
- DODGEBALL 92 was the first Quadruple Birthday, in celebration of Lauren Stopa (June 15), Diana DiBuccio (June 14), Melissa Kerr (June 14), and Valerie Winston (June 10).
- The four ladies ran the show as they saw fit: a secret
Pick Your Poison
team selection with hand-picked captains Lauren Winston and Alison Bertsch; captains were allowed to trade one player; hitting the
Letsche Rims
and
scoring in the trash can served as forms of team regeneration; birthday girls picked which side they'd join after teams were formed (DiBuccio/Stopa on Team ALISON, Kerr/Winston on Team LAUREN)
- With the win, Lauren Winston moves to 3-3-2, having only defeated women in her storied career. Alison unfortunately drops to 1-3-1. This was the third two-event Alison captained a team (TWENTY-TWO, 72, and 92).
- Only four games were completed in all; an extremely low number. Though in progress, the fifth game came to a hault when the lights shut off at 10:30.
DODGEBALL 93
The second
DODGEBALL 100 Captains Drawing
makes its way to Wall High School this coming Saturday night,
June 23
!
Congratulations to the
Top 21
[in alphabetical order by first name]:
Alison Bertsch, Chris Adams, Dan Spengeman, Derek Carty, Diana DiBuccio, John Tronolone, Justin Pierce*, Kevin Adams*, Kevin Fitzpatrick, Kevin Megill, Lauren Freda, Lauren Winston, Lenny Herrera, Mike Krott, Rob Avakian, Ryan Letsche, Ryan McCrorey, Sara DeCuir, Steve Adams, Tom Adams, Valerie Winston.
(*Won the first drawing at DODGEBALL 90 and will not be eligible for the second)
More on the captains match in the coming days!

A big-mouth, a giant killer, a silent assassin, and an "unSTOPAble" one.
Four combustible elements - one heated war.

It was no secret DODGEBALL 92 would throw a few curveballs, literally and figuratively. The team selections alone left players with puzzled looks on their faces, questioning the calls of the decision-makers. As for the stipulations, one second set in stone, the next changed completely, creating further havoc and chaos for the 20-plus in attendance. Though it took some time and effort to get the rules regulated and competitors situated, eventually DODGEBALL 92 would come to produce some five-star action on both a collective level and individual basis.

LAUREN WINSTON vs. ALISON BERTSCH
A never-before-seen match headlined the 92nd dodgeball spectacular. The sister of one of the birthday gals and a no fear, no nonsense powerhouse shared the spotlight in only the third Pick Your Poison match-up. With the addition of not one, but two rims, anything and everything was bound to happen during this explosive, three-hour encounter.

Team LAUREN won the kick-off round rather easily, lasting no more than ten minutes tops. But the award-winning Bertsch wouldn't back down, gaining the upper hand in Game 2. It was at the conclusion of these two action-packed games that the fast-paced, and almost suicidal "strategy" if you will ceased to exist.

Game 3 and especially Game 4, most notable for the remarkable showing of mega-star Tom Adams, would have the crowd on the edge of their seats. Easily comparable with that of DODGEBALL 90, this last hour and half will certainly be remembered for months to come. And yes, through the initial turmoil and some would say debatable stipulations, one word can truly sum up DODGEBALL 92; memorable.

The most unorganized, chaotic event in history? It may very well have been and that is truly something to remember.

Award-winning legend Lauren Winston picked up her third career win, defeating fearless frontrunner Alison Bertsch at DODGEBALL 92, 3 games to 1.

Moments & Stars: Tom Adams's amazing 15-minute solo Game 4 performance; Sascha Basista and Dan Turner putting up one hell of a fight also in Game 4; the pregame shenanigans of John Tronolone and Juan Londono

"The event was one of the better ones that I have been too ... Game 4, while long as hell, was the most fun and the best I've palyed in a while. Good times."
- DAN TURNER

RECORDS
> Attendance: 27
> Notable Returns: Matt Larsen (Last appearance at DODGEBALL 71); Max O'Rielly (Last appearance at DODGEBALL 82); Meredith Lewis (Last appearance at DODGEBALL EIGHTY-THREE)
> New Players: (2) Chris Mullan and Evan Fenton

- DODGEBALL 92 was the first Quadruple Birthday, in celebration of Lauren Stopa (June 15), Diana DiBuccio (June 14), Melissa Kerr (June 14), and Valerie Winston (June 10).
- The four ladies ran the show as they saw fit: a secret Pick Your Poison team selection with hand-picked captains Lauren Winston and Alison Bertsch; captains were allowed to trade one player; hitting the Letsche Rims and scoring in the trash can served as forms of team regeneration; birthday girls picked which side they'd join after teams were formed (DiBuccio/Stopa on Team ALISON, Kerr/Winston on Team LAUREN)
- With the win, Lauren Winston moves to 3-3-2, having only defeated women in her storied career. Alison unfortunately drops to 1-3-1. This was the third two-event Alison captained a team (TWENTY-TWO, 72, and 92).
- Only four games were completed in all; an extremely low number. Though in progress, the fifth game came to a hault when the lights shut off at 10:30.

DODGEBALL 93
The second DODGEBALL 100 Captains Drawing makes its way to Wall High School this coming Saturday night, June 23!

Congratulations to the Top 21 [in alphabetical order by first name]:
Alison Bertsch, Chris Adams, Dan Spengeman, Derek Carty, Diana DiBuccio, John Tronolone, Justin Pierce*, Kevin Adams*, Kevin Fitzpatrick, Kevin Megill, Lauren Freda, Lauren Winston, Lenny Herrera, Mike Krott, Rob Avakian, Ryan Letsche, Ryan McCrorey, Sara DeCuir, Steve Adams, Tom Adams, Valerie Winston.

(*Won the first drawing at DODGEBALL 90 and will not be eligible for the second)

More on the captains match in the coming days!
